definition[0]: a country in East Asia, west of Japan and east of China, which is officially called the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. Population: 24,720,407 (2014). Capital: Pyongyang. North Korea was formed in 1945 when Korea was divided into two countries (North Korea and South Korea) by the US and the former Soviet Union.
